skill.name: documentation
skill.description: Enforces documentation standards and structure for this project. This skill should be used when creating, updating, or organizing documentation to ensure compliance with project rules, prevent redundancy, and maintain screen-based organization. Activates when user asks to create/update docs or when documentation needs to be generated.

security_audit.summary: Documentation management skill with shell scripts for section-level file operations. All scripts operate only on markdown files within the docs directory using safe text processing utilities. No network activity or sensitive system access detected.

medium_findings.title: File write operations in scripts
medium_findings.description: Scripts use 'mv' to replace files and 'mktemp' for temp files during write operations. Example from doc-update-section.sh line 80: 'mv "$TEMP_FILE" "$FILE"'. This is standard practice for atomic file replacement but could be misused if user provides malicious paths. The skill relies on user-provided file paths and does not implement path validation beyond file existence checks.

low_findings.title: Temporary file creation with mktemp
low_findings.description: Scripts create temporary files using 'mktemp' for safe file operations. While generally safe, the temp files are created in system temp directory. Example from doc-find-duplicates.sh line 26: 'TEMP_DIR=$(mktemp -d)'. No sensitive data is written to these temp files.

content.value_statement: Managing documentation across large projects leads to duplicate files and inconsistent structure. This skill provides section-level file operations, templates, and automated checks to maintain clean, organized documentation with 80-98% context reduction.
actual_capabilities: Search documentation without reading full files using doc-search.sh
Extract, update, or delete specific sections by heading name
Get file metadata (lines, sections, code blocks) without loading content
Apply templates for screen documentation, guides, and architecture docs
Detect duplicate content across documentation files
Validate documentation against project rules and size limits
limitations: Operates only on markdown files within the docs directory
Does not generate documentation content automatically
Requires user to provide section headings for precise operations
Cannot validate code references or test code examples

best_practices: Always search for existing docs before creating new files to prevent duplicates
Keep documentation files under 500 lines using the split workflow when approaching limits
Include code references with file:line format in all technical documentation
anti_patterns: Creating duplicate documentation for the same feature in multiple locations
Writing documentation files exceeding 500 lines without splitting
Including code examples without language specification or file references

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. The shell scripts run locally and are platform-independent.

faq.question: What file types can I process?
faq.answer: Scripts work with markdown (.md) files in the docs directory. The skill is designed for structured documentation.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing documentation?
faq.answer: Use doc-search.sh to find relevant content, then doc-get-section.sh to read specific sections before updating.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. Scripts only access the docs directory, use safe temp files, and make no network calls or system modifications.

faq.question: Why are scripts showing file content instead of updating?
faq.answer: Ensure you provide correct file paths and section headings. Use doc-list-sections.sh first to verify section names.

faq.question: How does this compare to other documentation tools?
faq.answer: Unlike full documentation generators, this skill provides surgical file operations for existing documentation management.
